005
006package gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.metapath.item.atomic;
007
008import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.metapath.function.InvalidValueForCastFunctionException;
009import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.metapath.type.IAtomicOrUnionType;
010import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.metapath.type.impl.TypeConstants;
011
012import java.time.ZonedDateTime;
013
014import edu.umd.cs.findbugs.annotations.NonNull;
015
016/**
017 * An atomic Metapath item containing a temporal data value.
018 */
019public interface ITemporalItem extends IAnyAtomicItem {
020  /**
021   * Get the type information for this item.
022   *
023   * @return the type information
024   */
025  @NonNull
026  static IAtomicOrUnionType<ITemporalItem> type() {
027    return TypeConstants.TEMPORAL_TYPE;
028  }
029
030  /**
031   * Cast the provided type to this item type.
032   *
033   * @param item
034   *          the item to cast
035   * @return the original item if it is already this type, otherwise a new item
036   *         cast to this type
037   * @throws InvalidValueForCastFunctionException
038   *           if the provided {@code item} cannot be cast to this type
039   */
040  @NonNull
041  static ITemporalItem cast(@NonNull IAnyAtomicItem item) {
042    ITemporalItem retval;
043    if (item instanceof ITemporalItem) {
044      retval = (ITemporalItem) item;
045    } else {
046      String value;
047      try {
048        value = item.asString();
049      } catch (IllegalStateException ex) {
050        // asString can throw IllegalStateException exception
051        throw new InvalidValueForCastFunctionException(ex);
052      }
053
054      try {
055        retval = IDateTimeItem.valueOf(value);
056      } catch (IllegalStateException ex) {
057        try {
058          retval = IDateItem.valueOf(value);
059        } catch (IllegalStateException ex2) {
060          InvalidValueForCastFunctionException newEx = new InvalidValueForCastFunctionException(
061              String.format("Value '%s' cannot be parsed as either a date or date/time value", value),
062              ex2);
063          newEx.addSuppressed(ex);
064          throw newEx; // NOPMD context as suppressed
065        }
066      }
067    }
068    return retval;
069  }
070
071  /**
072   * Determine if the temporal item has a timezone.
073   *
074   * @return {@code true} if the temporal item has a timezone or {@code false}
075   *         otherwise
076   */
077  boolean hasTimezone();
078
079  /**
080   * Get the "wrapped" date/time value.
081   *
082   * @return the underlying date value
083   */
084  @NonNull
085  ZonedDateTime asZonedDateTime();
086
087  /**
088   * Compares this value with the argument.
089   *
090   * @param item
091   *          the item to compare with this value
092   * @return a negative integer, zero, or a positive integer if this value is less
093   *         than, equal to, or greater than the {@code item}.
094   */
095  default int compareTo(@NonNull ITemporalItem item) {
096    return asZonedDateTime().compareTo(item.asZonedDateTime());
097  }
098}
